snippet: The Coast Guard made the decision after searching six days for 33 crew members of the 790-feet commercial cargo ship, which sank last week during Hurricane Joaquin.
abstract: Coast Guard announces it is ending search for survivors from missing cargo ship El Faro, which disappeared after sailing into Hurricane Joaquin; relatives of ship's crew who have gathered in Jacksonville, Fla, in six days since ship's disappearance grapple with implications of called-off search.
lead_paragraph: The Coast Guard made the decision after searching six days for 33 crew members of the 790-feet commercial cargo ship, which sank last week during Hurricane Joaquin.

headline.main: Coast Guard to Suspend Search for Survivors of El Faro
headline.print_headline: Coast Guard Ends Search for Ship Lost in a Hurricane
